=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D
# A generic, single database configuration.

[alembic]
# path to migration scripts.
# Use forward slashes (/) also on windows to provide an os agnostic path
script_location =3D alembic_migrations

# template used to generate migration file names; The default value is
%%(rev)s_%%(slug)s
# Uncomment the line below if you want the files to be prepended with date
and time
# file_template =3D
%%(year)d_%%(month).2d_%%(day).2d_%%(hour).2d%%(minute).2d-%%(rev)s_%%(slug=
)s

# sys.path path, will be prepended to sys.path if present.
# defaults to the current working directory.
prepend_sys_path =3D .

# timezone to use when rendering the date within the migration file
# as well as the filename.
# If specified, requires the python>=3D3.9 or backports.zoneinfo library.
# Any required deps can installed by adding `alembic[tz]` to the pip
requirements
# string value is passed to ZoneInfo()
# leave blank for localtime
# timezone =3D

# max length of characters to apply to the "slug" field
# truncate_slug_length =3D 40

# set to 'true' to run the environment during
# the 'revision' command, regardless of autogenerate
# revision_environment =3D false

# set to 'true' to allow .pyc and .pyo files without
# a source .py file to be detected as revisions in the
# versions/ directory
# sourceless =3D false

# version location specification; This defaults
# to alembic/versions.  When using multiple version
# directories, initial revisions must be specified with --version-path.
# The path separator used here should be the separator specified by
"version_path_separator" below.
# version_locations =3D %(here)s/bar:%(here)s/bat:alembic/versions

# version path separator; As mentioned above, this is the character used to
split
# version_locations. The default within new alembic.ini files is "os",
which uses os.pathsep.
# If this key is omitted entirely, it falls back to the legacy behavior of
splitting on spaces and/or commas.
# Valid values for version_path_separator are:
#
# version_path_separator =3D :
# version_path_separator =3D ;
# version_path_separator =3D space
# version_path_separator =3D newline
version_path_separator =3D os  # Use os.pathsep. Default configuration used
for new projects.

# set to 'true' to search source files recursively
# in each "version_locations" directory
# new in Alembic version 1.10
# recursive_version_locations =3D false

# the output encoding used when revision files
# are written from script.py.mako
# output_encoding =3D utf-8


# We are including this url in the env.py file
# then we can use the .env file to set the url
# sqlalchemy.url =3D postgresql+asyncpg://postgres:password@localhost
:5432/mydatabase


[post_write_hooks]
# post_write_hooks defines scripts or Python functions that are run
# on newly generated revision scripts.  See the documentation for further
# detail and examples

# format using "black" - use the console_scripts runner, against the
"black" entrypoint
# hooks =3D black
# black.type =3D console_scripts
# black.entrypoint =3D black
# black.options =3D -l 79 REVISION_SCRIPT_FILENAME

# lint with attempts to fix using "ruff" - use the exec runner, execute a
binary
# hooks =3D ruff
# ruff.type =3D exec
# ruff.executable =3D %(here)s/.venv/bin/ruff
# ruff.options =3D --fix REVISION_SCRIPT_FILENAME

# Logging configuration
[loggers]
keys =3D root,sqlalchemy,alembic

[handlers]
keys =3D console

[formatters]
keys =3D generic

[logger_root]
level =3D WARN
handlers =3D console
qualname =3D

[logger_sqlalchemy]
level =3D WARN
handlers =3D
qualname =3D sqlalchemy.engine

[logger_alembic]
level =3D INFO
handlers =3D
qualname =3D alembic

[handler_console]
class =3D StreamHandler
args =3D (sys.stderr,)
level =3D NOTSET
formatter =3D generic

[formatter_generic]
format =3D %(levelname)-5.5s [%(name)s] %(message)s
datefmt =3D %H:%M:%S

=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D

=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D
FROM python:3.12-bookworm

# Set the working directory
WORKDIR /app

# The uv installer requires curl (and certificates) to download the release
archive
RUN apt-get update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends curl
ca-certificates

# Download the latest uv installer
ADD https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh /uv-installer.sh

# Run the uv installer then remove it
RUN sh /uv-installer.sh && rm /uv-installer.sh

# Ensure the installed binary is on the `PATH`
ENV PATH=3D"/root/.local/bin/:$PATH"

# Copy dependency files first to leverage Docker caching
COPY pyproject.toml uv.lock ./

# Install dependencies using uv
RUN uv sync --frozen

ENV PATH=3D"/app/.venv/bin:$PATH"

# Copy the rest of the application code
COPY . .

# Expose the application port
EXPOSE 8000

# Command to run the application
CMD ["./start.sh"]

=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=
=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D
import time
import re
import subprocess
import os
from watchdog.observers import Observer
from watchdog.events import FileSystemEventHandler
from threading import Timer

# Updated regex to include main.py, schemas.py, and all .py files in
app/routes
WATCHER_REGEX_PATTERN =3D re.compile(r"(main\.py|schemas\.py|routes/.*\.py)=
$")
APP_PATH =3D "app"


class MyHandler(FileSystemEventHandler):
    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.debounce_timer =3D None
        self.last_modified =3D 0

    def on_modified(self, event):
        if not event.is_directory and WATCHER_REGEX_PATTERN.search(
            os.path.relpath(event.src_path, APP_PATH)
        ):
            current_time =3D time.time()
            if current_time - self.last_modified > 1:
                self.last_modified =3D current_time
                if self.debounce_timer:
                    self.debounce_timer.cancel()
                self.debounce_timer =3D Timer(1.0, self.execute_command,
[event.src_path])
                self.debounce_timer.start()

    def execute_command(self, file_path):
        print(f"File {file_path} has been modified and saved.")
        self.run_mypy_checks()
        self.run_openapi_schema_generation()

    def run_mypy_checks(self):
        """Run mypy type checks and print output."""
        print("Running mypy type checks...")
        result =3D subprocess.run(
            ["uv", "run", "mypy", "app"],
            capture_output=3DTrue,
            text=3DTrue,
            check=3DFalse,
        )
        print(result.stdout, result.stderr, sep=3D"\n")
        print(
            "Type errors detected! We recommend checking the mypy output
for "
            "more information on the issues."
            if result.returncode
            else "No type errors detected."
        )

    def run_openapi_schema_generation(self):
        """Run the OpenAPI schema generation command."""
        print("Proceeding with OpenAPI schema generation...")
        try:
            subprocess.run(
                [
                    "uv",
                    "run",
                    "python",
                    "-m",
                    "commands.generate_openapi_schema",
                ],
                check=3DTrue,
            )
            print("OpenAPI schema generation completed successfully.")
        except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
            print(f"An error occurred while generating OpenAPI schema: {e}"=
)


if __name__ =3D=3D "__main__":
    observer =3D Observer()
    observer.schedule(MyHandler(), APP_PATH, recursive=3DTrue)
    observer.start()
    try:
        while True:
            time.sleep(1)
    except KeyboardInterrupt:
        observer.stop()
    observer.join()

import asyncio
import os
from urllib.parse import urlparse

from logging.config import fileConfig

from sqlalchemy import pool
from sqlalchemy.engine import Connection
from sqlalchemy.ext.asyncio import async_engine_from_config

from alembic import context
from app.models import Base
from dotenv import load_dotenv

load_dotenv()

# this is the Alembic Config object, which provides
# access to the values within the .ini file in use.
config =3D context.config

# Interpret the config file for Python logging.
# This line sets up loggers basically.
if config.config_file_name is not None:
    fileConfig(config.config_file_name)

# add your model's MetaData object here
# for 'autogenerate' support
target_metadata =3D Base.metadata
# target_metadata =3D None

# other values from the config, defined by the needs of env.py,
# can be acquired:
# my_important_option =3D config.get_main_option("my_important_option")
# ... etc.

# Retrieve the database URL from the environment
# set it during execution
database_url =3D os.getenv("DATABASE_URL")

if not database_url:
    raise ValueError("DATABASE_URL environment variable is not set!")

parsed_db_url =3D urlparse(database_url)

async_db_connection_url =3D (

f"postgresql+asyncpg://{parsed_db_url.username}:{parsed_db_url.password}@"
    f"{parsed_db_url.hostname}{':' + str(parsed_db_url.port) if
parsed_db_url.port else ''}"
    f"{parsed_db_url.path}"
)

config.set_main_option("sqlalchemy.url", async_db_connection_url)


def run_migrations_offline() -> None:
    """Run migrations in 'offline' mode.

    This configures the context with just a URL
    and not an Engine, though an Engine is acceptable
    here as well.  By skipping the Engine creation
    we don't even need a DBAPI to be available.

    Calls to context.execute() here emit the given string to the
    script output.

    """
    url =3D config.get_main_option("sqlalchemy.url")
    context.configure(
        url=3Durl,
        target_metadata=3Dtarget_metadata,
        literal_binds=3DTrue,
        dialect_opts=3D{"paramstyle": "named"},
    )

    with context.begin_transaction():
        context.run_migrations()


def do_run_migrations(connection: Connection) -> None:
    context.configure(connection=3Dconnection,
target_metadata=3Dtarget_metadata)

    with context.begin_transaction():
        context.run_migrations()


async def run_async_migrations() -> None:
    """In this scenario we need to create an Engine
    and associate a connection with the context.

    """

    connectable =3D async_engine_from_config(
        config.get_section(config.config_ini_section, {}),
        prefix=3D"sqlalchemy.",
        poolclass=3Dpool.NullPool,
    )

    async with connectable.connect() as connection:
        await connection.run_sync(do_run_migrations)

    await connectable.dispose()


def run_migrations_online() -> None:
    """Run migrations in 'online' mode."""

    asyncio.run(run_async_migrations())


if context.is_offline_mode():
    run_migrations_offline()
else:
    run_migrations_online()

from pathlib import Path
import urllib.parse

from fastapi_mail import FastMail, MessageSchema, ConnectionConfig,
MessageType
from .config import settings
from .models import User


def get_email_config():
    conf =3D ConnectionConfig(
        MAIL_USERNAME=3Dsettings.MAIL_USERNAME,
        MAIL_PASSWORD=3Dsettings.MAIL_PASSWORD,
        MAIL_FROM=3Dsettings.MAIL_FROM,
        MAIL_PORT=3Dsettings.MAIL_PORT,
        MAIL_SERVER=3Dsettings.MAIL_SERVER,
        MAIL_FROM_NAME=3Dsettings.MAIL_FROM_NAME,
        MAIL_STARTTLS=3Dsettings.MAIL_STARTTLS,
        MAIL_SSL_TLS=3Dsettings.MAIL_SSL_TLS,
        USE_CREDENTIALS=3Dsettings.USE_CREDENTIALS,
        VALIDATE_CERTS=3Dsettings.VALIDATE_CERTS,
        TEMPLATE_FOLDER=3DPath(__file__).parent / settings.TEMPLATE_DIR,
    )
    return conf


async def send_reset_password_email(user: User, token: str):
    conf =3D get_email_config()
    email =3D user.email
    base_url =3D f"{settings.FRONTEND_URL}/password-recovery/confirm?"
    params =3D {"token": token}
    encoded_params =3D urllib.parse.urlencode(params)
    link =3D f"{base_url}{encoded_params}"
    message =3D MessageSchema(
        subject=3D"Password recovery",
        recipients=3D[email],
        template_body=3D{"username": email, "link": link},
        subtype=3DMessageType.html,
    )

    fm =3D FastMail(conf)
    await fm.send_message(message, template_name=3D"password_reset.html")

import uuid
import re

from typing import Optional

from fastapi import Depends, Request

    BaseUserManager,
    FastAPIUsers,
    UUIDIDMixin,
    InvalidPasswordException,
)

from fastapi_users.authentication import (
    AuthenticationBackend,

    JWTStrategy,
)

from .config import settings

from .models import User

AUTH_URL_PATH =3D "auth"


class UserManager(UUIDIDMixin, BaseUserManager[User, uuid.UUID]):
    reset_password_token_secret =3D settings.RESET_PASSWORD_SECRET_KEY
    verification_token_secret =3D settings.VERIFICATION_SECRET_KEY

    async def on_after_register(self, user: User, request:
Optional[Request] =3D None):
        print(f"User {user.id} has registered.")

    async def on_after_forgot_password(
        self, user: User, token: str, request: Optional[Request] =3D None
    ):
        await send_reset_password_email(user, token)

    async def on_after_request_verify(
        self, user: User, token: str, request: Optional[Request] =3D None
    ):
        print(f"Verification requested for user {user.id}. Verification
token: {token}")

    async def validate_password(
        self,
        password: str,
        user: UserCreate,
    ) -> None:
        errors =3D []

        if len(password) < 8:
            errors.append("Password should be at least 8 characters.")
        if user.email in password:
            errors.append("Password should not contain e-mail.")
        if not any(char.isupper() for char in password):
            errors.append("Password should contain at least one uppercase
letter.")
        if not re.search(r'[!@#$%^&*(),.?":{}|<>]', password):
            errors.append("Password should contain at least one special
character.")

        if errors:
            raise InvalidPasswordException(reason=3Derrors)


async def get_user_manager(user_db: SQLAlchemyUserDatabase =3D
Depends(get_user_db)):
    yield UserManager(user_db)


bearer_transport =3D BearerTransport(tokenUrl=3Df"{AUTH_URL_PATH}/jwt/login=
")


def get_jwt_strategy() -> JWTStrategy:
    return JWTStrategy(
        secret=3Dsettings.ACCESS_SECRET_KEY,
        lifetime_seconds=3Dsettings.ACCESS_TOKEN_EXPIRE_SECONDS,
    )


auth_backend =3D AuthenticationBackend(
    name=3D"jwt",
    transport=3Dbearer_transport,
    get_strategy=3Dget_jwt_strategy,
)

fastapi_users =3D FastAPIUsers[User, uuid.UUID](get_user_manager,
[auth_backend])

current_active_user =3D fastapi_users.current_user(active=3DTrue)

@router.get("/", response_model=3DPage[ItemRead])
async def read_item(
    db: AsyncSession =3D Depends(get_async_session),
    user: User =3D Depends(current_active_user),
    page: int =3D Query(1, ge=3D1, description=3D"Page number"),
    size: int =3D Query(10, ge=3D1, le=3D100, description=3D"Page size"),
):
    params =3D Params(page=3Dpage, size=3Dsize)
    query =3D select(Item).filter(Item.user_id =3D=3D user.id)
    return await apaginate(db, query, params, transformer=3Dtransform_items=
)


@router.post("/", response_model=3DItemRead)
async def create_item(
    item: ItemCreate,
    db: AsyncSession =3D Depends(get_async_session),
    user: User =3D Depends(current_active_user),
):
    db_item =3D Item(**item.model_dump(), user_id=3Duser.id)
    db.add(db_item)
    await db.commit()
    await db.refresh(db_item)
    return db_item


@router.delete("/{item_id}")
async def delete_item(
    item_id: UUID,
    db: AsyncSession =3D Depends(get_async_session),
    user: User =3D Depends(current_active_user),
):
    result =3D await db.execute(
        select(Item).filter(Item.id =3D=3D item_id, Item.user_id =3D=3D use=
r.id)
    )
    item =3D result.scalars().first()

    if not item:
        raise HTTPException(status_code=3D404, detail=3D"Item not found or =
not
authorized")

    await db.delete(item)
    await db.commit()

    return {"message": "Item successfully deleted"}

import json
from pathlib import Path
from app.main import app
import os

from dotenv import load_dotenv

load_dotenv()

OUTPUT_FILE =3D os.getenv("OPENAPI_OUTPUT_FILE")


def generate_openapi_schema(output_file):
    schema =3D app.openapi()
    output_path =3D Path(output_file)

    updated_schema =3D remove_operation_id_tag(schema)

    output_path.write_text(json.dumps(updated_schema, indent=3D2))
    print(f"OpenAPI schema saved to {output_file}")


def remove_operation_id_tag(schema):
    """
    Removes the tag prefix from the operation IDs in the OpenAPI schema.

    This cleans up the OpenAPI operation IDs that are used by the frontend
    client generator to create the names of the functions. The modified
    schema is then returned.
    """
    for path_data in schema["paths"].values():
        for operation in path_data.values():
            tag =3D operation["tags"][0]
            operation_id =3D operation["operationId"]
            to_remove =3D f"{tag}-"
            new_operation_id =3D operation_id[len(to_remove) :]
            operation["operationId"] =3D new_operation_id
    return schema


if __name__ =3D=3D "__main__":
    generate_openapi_schema(OUTPUT_FILE)

  "info": {
    "title": "FastAPI",

  "paths": {
    "/auth/jwt/login": {
      "post": {
        "tags": [
          "auth"
        ],
        "summary": "Auth:Jwt.Login",
        "operationId": "auth:jwt.login_post",
        "requestBody": {
          "content": {
            "application/x-www-form-urlencoded": {
              "schema": {
                "$ref": "#/components/schemas/login_post"
              }
            }
          },
          "required": true
        },
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "Successful Response",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/BearerResponse"
                },
                "example": {
                  "access_token":
"eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJ1c2VyX2lkIjoiOTIyMWZmYzktNjQwZi00M=
zcyLTg2ZDMtY2U2NDJjYmE1NjAzIiwiYXVkIjoiZmFzdGFwaS11c2VyczphdXRoIiwiZXhwIjox=
NTcxNTA0MTkzfQ.M10bjOe45I5Ncu_uXvOmVV8QxnL-nZfcH96U90JaocI",
                  "token_type": "bearer"
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "400": {
            "description": "Bad Request",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/ErrorModel"
                },
                "examples": {
                  "LOGIN_BAD_CREDENTIALS": {
                    "summary": "Bad credentials or the user is inactive.",
                    "value": {
                      "detail": "LOGIN_BAD_CREDENTIALS"
                    }
                  },
                  "LOGIN_USER_NOT_VERIFIED": {
                    "summary": "The user is not verified.",
                    "value": {
                      "detail": "LOGIN_USER_NOT_VERIFIED"
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "422": {
            "description": "Validation Error",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/HTTPValidationError"
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "/auth/jwt/logout": {
      "post": {
        "tags": [
          "auth"
        ],
        "summary": "Auth:Jwt.Logout",
        "operationId": "auth:jwt.logout_post",
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "Successful Response",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {}
              }
            }
          },
          "401": {
            "description": "Missing token or inactive user."
          }
        },
        "security": [
          {
            "OAuth2PasswordBearer": []
          }
        ]
      }
    },
    "/auth/register": {
      "post": {
        "tags": [
          "auth"
        ],
        "summary": "Register:Register",
        "operationId": "register:register_post",
        "requestBody": {
          "content": {
            "application/json": {
              "schema": {
                "$ref": "#/components/schemas/UserCreate"
              }
            }
          },
          "required": true
        },
        "responses": {
          "201": {
            "description": "Successful Response",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/UserRead"
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "400": {
            "description": "Bad Request",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/ErrorModel"
                },
                "examples": {
                  "REGISTER_USER_ALREADY_EXISTS": {
                    "summary": "A user with this email already exists.",
                    "value": {
                      "detail": "REGISTER_USER_ALREADY_EXISTS"
                    }
                  },
                  "REGISTER_INVALID_PASSWORD": {
                    "summary": "Password validation failed.",
                    "value": {
                      "detail": {
                        "code": "REGISTER_INVALID_PASSWORD",
                        "reason": "Password should beat least 3 characters"
                      }
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "422": {
            "description": "Validation Error",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/HTTPValidationError"
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },

        "responses": {

"

    "/auth/verify": {
      "post": {
        "tags": [
          "auth"
        ],
        "summary": "Verify:Verify",
        "operationId": "verify:verify_post",
        "requestBody": {
          "content": {
            "application/json": {
              "schema": {
                "$ref": "#/components/schemas/Body_auth-verify_verify_post"
              }
            }
          },
          "required": true
        },
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "Successful Response",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/UserRead"
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "400": {
            "description": "Bad Request",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/ErrorModel"
                },
                "examples": {
                  "VERIFY_USER_BAD_TOKEN": {
                    "summary": "Bad token, not existing user ornot the
e-mail currently set for the user.",
                    "value": {
                      "detail": "VERIFY_USER_BAD_TOKEN"
                    }
                  },
                  "VERIFY_USER_ALREADY_VERIFIED": {
                    "summary": "The user is already verified.",
                    "value": {
                      "detail": "VERIFY_USER_ALREADY_VERIFIED"
                    }
                  }
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "422": {
            "description": "Validation Error",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/HTTPValidationError"
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    },
    "/users/me": {

        ],
        "summary": "Users:Current User",
        "operationId": "users:current_user_get",

          "200": {

                }
              }
            }
          },
          "401": {
            "description": "Missing token or inactive user."
          }
        },
        "security": [
          {
            "OAuth2PasswordBearer": []
          }
        ]
      },
      "patch": {
        "tags": [
          "users"
        ],
        "summary": "Users:Patch Current User",
        "operationId": "users:patch_current_user_patch",

              }
            }
          },

        "responses": {
          "200": {

            "description": "Validation Error",

        "security": [

    "/users/{id}": {

        "tags": [
          "users"
        ],
        "summary": "Users:User",
        "operationId": "users:user_get",
        "security": [
          {
            "OAuth2PasswordBearer": []
          }
        ],
        "parameters": [
          {
            "name": "id",
            "in": "path",
            "required": true,
            "schema": {
              "type": "string",
              "title": "Id"
            }
          }
        ],
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "Successful Response",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/UserRead"
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "401": {
            "description": "Missing token or inactive user."
          },
          "403": {
            "description": "Not a superuser."
          },
          "404": {
            "description": "The user does not exist."
          },
          "422": {
            "description": "Validation Error",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/HTTPValidationError"
                }
              }
            }
          }
        }
      },
      "patch": {
        "tags": [
          "users"
        ],
        "summary": "Users:Patch User",

        "security": [
          {
            "OAuth2PasswordBearer": []
          }
        ],
        "parameters": [
          {
            "name": "id",
            "in": "path",
            "required": true,
            "schema": {
              "type": "string",
              "title": "Id"
            }
          }
        ],
        "requestBody": {
          "required": true,

            "application/json": {

          }
        },
        "responses": {
          "200": {
            "description": "Successful Response",
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "schema": {
                  "$ref": "#/components/schemas/UserRead"
                }
              }
            }
          },
          "401": {
            "description": "Missing token or inactive user."
          },
          "403": {
            "description": "Not a superuser."
          },
          "404": {
            "description": "The user does not exist."
          },
          "400": {
            "content": {
              "application/json": {
                "examples": {
                  "UPDATE_USER_EMAIL_ALREADY_EXISTS": {
                    "summary": "A user with this email already exists.",
                    "value": {
                      "detail": "UPDATE_USER_EMAIL_ALREADY_EXISTS"
                    }
                  },
                  "UPDATE_USER_INVALID_PASSWORD": {
                    "summary": "Password validation failed.",

                }
              }

                "schema": {

      "delete": {

          "422": {

    "/authenticated-route": {
      "get": {
        "tags": [
          "custom-auth"
        ],
        "summary": "Authenticated Route",

              "application/json": {

  "components": {
    "schemas": {
      "BearerResponse": {
        "properties": {
          "access_token": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Access Token"
          },
          "token_type": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Token Type"
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "access_token",
          "token_type"
        ],
        "title": "BearerResponse"
      },
      "Body_auth-reset_forgot_password_post": {
        "properties": {
          "email": {
            "type": "string",
            "format": "email",
            "title": "Email"
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "email"
        ],
        "title": "Body_auth-reset:forgot_password_post"
      },
      "Body_auth-reset_reset_password_post": {
        "properties": {
          "token": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Token"
          },
          "password": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Password"
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "token",
          "password"
        ],
        "title": "Body_auth-reset:reset_password_post"
      },
      "Body_auth-verify_request-token_post": {
        "properties": {
          "email": {
            "type": "string",
            "format": "email",
            "title": "Email"
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "email"
        ],
        "title": "Body_auth-verify:request-token_post"
      },
      "Body_auth-verify_verify_post": {
        "properties": {
          "token": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Token"
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "token"
        ],
        "title": "Body_auth-verify:verify_post"
      },
      "ErrorModel": {
        "properties": {
          "detail": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "string"
              },
              {
                "additionalProperties": {
                  "type": "string"
                },
                "type": "object"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Detail"
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "detail"
        ],
        "title": "ErrorModel"
      },
      "HTTPValidationError": {
        "properties": {
          "detail": {
            "items": {
              "$ref": "#/components/schemas/ValidationError"
            },
            "type": "array",
            "title": "Detail"
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "title": "HTTPValidationError"
      },
      "UserCreate": {
        "properties": {
          "email": {
            "type": "string",
            "format": "email",
            "title": "Email"
          },
          "password": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Password"
          },
          "is_active": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "boolean"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Is Active",
            "default": true
          },
          "is_superuser": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "boolean"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Is Superuser",
            "default": false
          },
          "is_verified": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "boolean"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Is Verified",
            "default": false
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "email",
          "password"
        ],
        "title": "UserCreate"
      },
      "UserRead": {
        "properties": {
          "id": {
            "type": "string",
            "format": "uuid",
            "title": "Id"
          },
          "email": {
            "type": "string",
            "format": "email",
            "title": "Email"
          },
          "is_active": {
            "type": "boolean",
            "title": "Is Active",
            "default": true
          },
          "is_superuser": {
            "type": "boolean",
            "title": "Is Superuser",
            "default": false
          },
          "is_verified": {
            "type": "boolean",
            "title": "Is Verified",
            "default": false
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "id",
          "email"
        ],
        "title": "UserRead"
      },
      "UserUpdate": {
        "properties": {
          "password": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "string"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Password"
          },
          "email": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "string",
                "format": "email"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Email"
          },
          "is_active": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "boolean"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Is Active"
          },
          "is_superuser": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "boolean"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Is Superuser"
          },
          "is_verified": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "boolean"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Is Verified"
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "title": "UserUpdate"
      },
      "ValidationError": {
        "properties": {
          "loc": {
            "items": {
              "anyOf": [
                {
                  "type": "string"
                },
                {
                  "type": "integer"
                }
              ]
            },
            "type": "array",
            "title": "Location"
          },
          "msg": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Message"
          },
          "type": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Error Type"
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "loc",
          "msg",
          "type"
        ],
        "title": "ValidationError"
      },
      "login_post": {
        "properties": {
          "grant_type": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "string",
                "pattern": "password"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Grant Type"
          },
          "username": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Username"
          },
          "password": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Password"
          },
          "scope": {
            "type": "string",
            "title": "Scope",
            "default": ""
          },
          "client_id": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "string"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Client Id"
          },
          "client_secret": {
            "anyOf": [
              {
                "type": "string"
              },
              {
                "type": "null"
              }
            ],
            "title": "Client Secret"
          }
        },
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "username",
          "password"
        ],
        "title": "Body_auth-auth:jwt.login_post"
      }
    },
    "securitySchemes": {
      "OAuth2PasswordBearer": {
        "type": "oauth2",
        "flows": {
          "password": {
            "scopes": {},
            "tokenUrl": "auth/jwt/login"
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }

                    "detail": {

                            "Password should be at least 8 characters.",

character.",

        ],

l

import pytest
from fastapi import status
from sqlalchemy import select, insert
from app.models import Item


class TestItems:
    @pytest.mark.asyncio(loop_scope=3D"function")
    async def test_create_item(self, test_client, db_session,
authenticated_user):
        """Test creating an item."""
        item_data =3D {"name": "Test Item", "description": "Test Descriptio=
n"}
        create_response =3D await test_client.post(
            "/items/", json=3Ditem_data, headers=3Dauthenticated_user["head=
ers"]
        )

        assert create_response.status_code =3D=3D status.HTTP_200_OK
        created_item =3D create_response.json()
        assert created_item["name"] =3D=3D item_data["name"]
        assert created_item["description"] =3D=3D item_data["description"]

        # Check if the item is in the database
        item =3D await db_session.execute(
            select(Item).where(Item.id =3D=3D created_item["id"])
        )
        item =3D item.scalar()

        assert item is not None
        assert item.name =3D=3D item_data["name"]
        assert item.description =3D=3D item_data["description"]

    @pytest.mark.asyncio(loop_scope=3D"function")
    async def test_read_items(self, test_client, db_session,
authenticated_user):
        """Test reading items."""
        # Create multiple items
        items_data =3D [
            {
                "name": "First Item",
                "description": "First Description",
                "user_id": authenticated_user["user"].id,
            },
            {
                "name": "Second Item",
                "description": "Second Description",
                "user_id": authenticated_user["user"].id,
            },
        ]
        # create items in the database
        for item_data in items_data:
            await db_session.execute(insert(Item).values(**item_data))

        await db_session.commit()  # Add commit to ensure items are saved

        # Read items - test pagination response
        read_response =3D await test_client.get(
            "/items/", headers=3Dauthenticated_user["headers"]
        )
        assert read_response.status_code =3D=3D status.HTTP_200_OK
        response_data =3D read_response.json()

        # Check pagination structure
        assert "items" in response_data
        assert "total" in response_data
        assert "page" in response_data
        assert "size" in response_data

        items =3D response_data["items"]

        # Filter items created in this test (to avoid interference from
other tests)
        test_items =3D [
            item for item in items if item["name"] in ["First Item",
"Second Item"]
        ]

        assert len(test_items) =3D=3D 2
        assert any(item["name"] =3D=3D "First Item" for item in test_items)
        assert any(item["name"] =3D=3D "Second Item" for item in test_items=
)

    @pytest.mark.asyncio(loop_scope=3D"function")
    async def test_delete_item(self, test_client, db_session,
authenticated_user):
        """Test deleting an item."""
        # Create an item directly in the database
        item_data =3D {
            "name": "Item to Delete",
            "description": "Will be deleted",
            "user_id": authenticated_user["user"].id,
        }
        await db_session.execute(insert(Item).values(**item_data))

        # Get the created item from database
        db_item =3D (
            await db_session.execute(select(Item).where(Item.name =3D=3D
item_data["name"]))
        ).scalar()

        # Delete the item
        delete_response =3D await test_client.delete(
            f"/items/{db_item.id}", headers=3Dauthenticated_user["headers"]
        )
        assert delete_response.status_code =3D=3D status.HTTP_200_OK

        # Verify item is deleted from database
        db_check =3D (
            await db_session.execute(select(Item).where(Item.id =3D=3D
db_item.id))
        ).scalar()
        assert db_check is None

    @pytest.mark.asyncio(loop_scope=3D"function")

=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=3D=

FROM node:20-bookworm

# Set the working directory
WORKDIR /app

# Install pnpm globally
RUN npm install -g pnpm

# Copy package files and install dependencies
COPY package*.json ./

# Install dependencies as root (or myappuser, depending on your structure)
RUN pnpm install

## Switch to the non-root user
USER node

# Copy the rest of your application code
COPY . .

EXPOSE 3000

# Start the application
CMD ["./start.sh"]

import { NextResponse } from "next/server";
import type { NextRequest } from "next/server";
import { usersCurrentUser } from "@/app/clientService";

export async function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
  const token =3D request.cookies.get("accessToken");

  if (!token) {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL("/login", request.url));
  }

  const options =3D {
    headers: {
      Authorization: `Bearer ${token.value}`,
    },
  };

  const { error } =3D await usersCurrentUser(options);

  if (error) {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL("/login", request.url));
  }
  return NextResponse.next();
}

export const config =3D {
  matcher: ["/dashboard/:path*"],
};

const chokidar =3D require("chokidar");
const { exec } =3D require("child_process");
const { config } =3D require("dotenv");

config({ path: ".env.local" });

const openapiFile =3D process.env.OPENAPI_OUTPUT_FILE;
// Watch the specific file for changes
chokidar.watch(openapiFile).on("change", (path) =3D> {
  console.log(`File ${path} has been modified. Running generate-client...`)=
;
  exec("npm run generate-client", (error, stdout, stderr) =3D> {
    if (error) {
      console.error(`Error: ${error.message}`);
      return;
    }
    if (stderr) {
      console.error(`stderr: ${stderr}`);
      return;
    }
    console.log(`stdout: ${stdout}`);
  });
});

import { login } from "@/components/actions/login-action";

jest.mock("../app/clientService", () =3D> ({
  authJwtLogin: jest.fn(),

  const mockSet =3D jest.fn();
  return { cookies: jest.fn().mockResolvedValue({ set: mockSet }) };
});

jest.mock("next/navigation", () =3D> ({
  redirect: jest.fn(),
}));

describe("login action", () =3D> {
  it("should call login service action with the correct input", async () =
=3D>
{
    const formData =3D new FormData();
    formData.set("username", "a@a.com");
    formData.set("password", "Q12341414#");

    const mockSet =3D (await cookies()).set;

    // Mock a successful login
    (authJwtLogin as jest.Mock).mockResolvedValue({
      data: { access_token: "1245token" },
    });

    await login({}, formData);

    expect(authJwtLogin).toHaveBeenCalledWith({
      body: {
        username: "a@a.com",
        password: "Q12341414#",
      },
    });

    expect(cookies).toHaveBeenCalled();
    expect(mockSet).toHaveBeenCalledWith("accessToken", "1245token");
  });

  it("should should return an error if the server validation fails", async

    const formData =3D new FormData();
    formData.set("username", "invalid@invalid.com");
    formData.set("password", "Q12341414#");

    (authJwtLogin as jest.Mock).mockResolvedValue({
      error: {
        detail: "LOGIN_BAD_CREDENTIALS",
      },
    });

    const result =3D await login(undefined, formData);

    expect(authJwtLogin).toHaveBeenCalledWith({
      body: {
        username: "invalid@invalid.com",
        password: "Q12341414#",
      },
    });

    expect(result).toEqual({
      server_validation_error: "LOGIN_BAD_CREDENTIALS",
    });

    expect(cookies).not.toHaveBeenCalled();
  });

  it("should should return an error if either the password or username is

    const formData =3D new FormData();
    formData.set("username", "");
    formData.set("password", "");

    const result =3D await login({}, formData);

    expect(authJwtLogin).not.toHaveBeenCalledWith();

    expect(result).toEqual({
      errors: {
        password: ["Password is required"],
        username: ["Username is required"],
      },
    });

    expect(cookies).not.toHaveBeenCalled();
  });

  it("should handle unexpected errors and return server error message",
async () =3D> {
    // Mock the authJwtLogin to throw an error
    const mockError =3D new Error("Network error");
    (authJwtLogin as jest.Mock).mockRejectedValue(mockError);

    const formData =3D new FormData();
    formData.append("username", "testuser");
    formData.append("password", "password123");

    const result =3D await login(undefined, formData);

    expect(result).toEqual({
      server_error: "An unexpected error occurred. Please try again later."=
,
    });
  });
});

</div><div dir=3D"auto">The Next.js FastAPI Template provides a solid found=
ation for scalable, high-performance web applications, following clean arch=
itecture and best practices. It simplifies development by integrating FastA=
PI, Pydantic, and Next.js with TypeScript and Zod, ensuring end-to-end type=
 safety and schema validation between frontend and backend.</div><div dir=
=3D"auto"><br></div><div dir=3D"auto">The FastAPI backend supports fully as=
ynchronous operations, optimizing database queries, API routes, and test ex=
ecution for better performance. Deployment is seamless, with both backend a=
nd frontend fully deployable to Vercel, enabling quick product releases wit=
h minimal configuration.</div><div dir=3D"auto"><br></div><div dir=3D"auto"=
>### Key features</div><div dir=3D"auto">=E2=9C=94 End-to-end type safety =
=E2=80=93 Automatically generated typed clients from the OpenAPI schema ens=
ure seamless API contracts between frontend and backend.</div><div dir=3D"a=
uto"><br></div><div dir=3D"auto">=E2=9C=94 Hot-reload updates =E2=80=93 The=
 client updates automatically when backend routes change, keeping FastAPI a=
nd Next.js in sync.</div><div dir=3D"auto"><br></div><div dir=3D"auto">=E2=
=9C=94 Versatile foundation =E2=80=93 Designed for MVPs and production-read=
y applications, with a pre-configured authentication system and API layer.<=
/div><div dir=3D"auto"><br></div><div dir=3D"auto">=E2=9C=94 Quick deployme=
nt =E2=80=93 Deploys a full-stack application=E2=80=94including authenticat=
ion flow and a dashboard=E2=80=94on Vercel in just a few steps.</div><div d=
ir=3D"auto"><br></div><div dir=3D"auto">=E2=9C=94 Production-ready authenti=
cation =E2=80=93 Includes a pre-configured authentication system and dashbo=
ard interface, allowing you to immediately start development with user mana=
gement features.</div><div dir=3D"auto"><br></div><div dir=3D"auto">## Tech=
nology stack</div><div dir=3D"auto">This template features a carefully sele=
cted set of technologies to ensure efficiency, scalability, and ease of use=
:</div><div dir=3D"auto"><br></div><div dir=3D"auto">- Zod + TypeScript =E2=
=80=93 Type safety and schema validation across the stack.</div><div dir=3D=
"auto">- fastapi-users =E2=80=93 Complete authentication system with:</div>=
<div dir=3D"auto">=C2=A0 =C2=A0 - Secure password hashing</div><div dir=3D"=
auto">=C2=A0 =C2=A0 - JWT authentication</div><div dir=3D"auto">- Email-bas=
ed password recovery</div><div dir=3D"auto">- shadcn/ui =E2=80=93 Prebuilt =
React components with Tailwind CSS.</div><div dir=3D"auto">- OpenAPI-fetch =
=E2=80=93 Fully typed client generation from the OpenAPI schema.</div><div =
dir=3D"auto">- UV =E2=80=93 Simplified dependency management and packaging.=
</div><div dir=3D"auto">- Docker Compose =E2=80=93 Consistent environments =
for development and production.</div><div dir=3D"auto">- Pre-commit hooks =
=E2=80=93 Automated code linting, formatting, and validation before commits=
.</div><div dir=3D"auto">- Vercel Deployment =E2=80=93 Serverless backend a=
nd scalable frontend, deployable with minimal configuration.</div><div dir=
